Explore Our Guide to the Citrus Hills Golf & Country Club Website & App Read More View Our Golf Courses 3 Courses, 1 Community Among the many privileges that accompany membership at Citrus Hills, is the extraordinary opportunity to play not one but three 18-hole championship golf courses. Our golf courses feature gently rolling fairways, well-manicured Tee boxes, and immaculately kept greens, each elevated and with its own special character. Whether you are a scratch golfer or beginner, come join us at Skyview, the Oaks, or Meadows golf courses. From a foursome with friends to tournaments, outings, and lessons, our PGA-certified professional staff can take care of every request expertly and efficiently. As well, our pro shops provide a wide array of clubs, shoes, balls, and apparel from top golf brands and vendors. We promise that you will enjoy a friendly and pleasurable golfing experience. Book Your Tee Time View Our Spa Specials Visit The Spa at BellaVita A retreat for rejuvenation. We encourage you to escape the pressures and pace of everyday life and encounter a delightful sanctuary, leaving you feeling pampered, fresh, and rejuvenated. The Spa at BellaVita features seven massage and skincare rooms, as well as twelve nail stations for luxurious treatments. From an extensive selection of services and products, our talented staff of professionals will deliver expert service with unsurpassed attention to detail to relax and revitalize your mind, body, and spirit. Enjoy a haven where every one of your face, nails, body, and spa care needs are met with precision and expertise. Visit The Tiki Bar, Grille, and Skyview Restaurants Give your taste buds something to talk about. Dining at Citrus Hills is truly a delicious experience. Each of our three dining venues provides unique and savory culinary creations. From lunch specials to themed dinners, our chefs use the finest ingredients available to create dishes that will satisfy and delight a diverse array of appetites. You'll never have to worry about what's for dinner; there is something here for everyone. View Our Restaurant Menus Events RSVP for our next event. With so many events to choose from, you're sure to find several that you like! The fastest way to make old friends is to meet others who share your interests and activities. It will be hard to find room on your calendar for all the fun we offer at Citrus Hills. You can gather for a Neighborhood Block Party at the Tiki Bar, delight in some friendly competition at monthly Trivia Nights, taste menus from other countries at our weekly themed dinners, or kick back and enjoy some live musical entertainment over dinner, just to name a few. Tiki Bar: Chopper Tiki Bar | mytiki.life Welcome to the mytiki.life v2 beta. This is a work in progress and there may be some bugs. If you find any issues or have feedback send me an email: [email¬†protected] . mytiki.life Home Tiki Mugs Swizzle Sticks Other Collectibles Collectors Creators Tiki Bars Home Tiki Bars Contact Request an update Sign in Create an account Search Quick Search Sign in Home Commercial Tiki Bars Chopper Tiki Bar Nashville, Tennessee, United States Add Visit Close Opened June 3rd, 2019. Barista Parlor owner and founder Andy Mumma, Isle of Printing founder Bryce McCloud and longtime Husk Nashville bar manager Mike Wolf have taken over the former Bar Luca space, to create a neo-tiki bar with a "Jetsons" meets "Polynesian Pop" vibe. The bar itself is trimmed out in bamboo, but the giant robot hovering over it and the sci-fi theming may scare away those looking for a more traditional tiki space. Still, Chopper has a serious rum collection at hand and their cocktails look to be on-point. Details Type Bar & Restaurant Phone (615) 348-8156 Address Nashville, Tennessee, United States Closed? No Links choppertiki.com instagram.com Gallery 2
                            Tiki Mugs Chopper Robot Mug - Orange Chopper Robot Mug - Turquoise 2
                            Swizzle Sticks CHOPPER, Tiki Bar - Red/White CHOPPER, Tiki Bar - Green/White 13
                            Visits Trader Tom ‚Äì 7 Dec 2024 Here for the weekend and had a great time exploring their regular and holiday menus!  Started with their Mai-Tai which was very good, then had the Tiger Milk off the holiday menu which was delicious!  Took a break and got some Burria Tacos from the food truck outside, then finished up with a Bot Barrel and a Dopamine cocktail.  Not a bad drink in the bunch.  All were very good, but my favorites were probably the Tiger Milk and the Dopamine. The Tiki Barber ‚Äì 8 Mar 2024 Great spot. Max was bartending both Friday and Sunday when we went ( he's a phenomenal bartender) cocktails were great, decor was cool and we meet up with local Tennessee Tikiphiles for a friend's birthday. It was a great trip/experience Cape FM ‚Äì 6 Sept 2019 I like the Robot Tiki concept.  When I went in 2019 it was quiet and pretty empty.  I went back in 2023 and it was crowded and tough to get a seat with a popular food truck outside. Drinks I had in 2019:
1) Jet Pilot - great taste overall, not strong, cinnamon very pleasant, nice clean finish
2) Robo Zombie - bright, also not strong, pleasing tabithablanken ‚Äì 3 Apr 2022 Went right after I dropped my stuff off at the Gaylord Hotel for my Nashville vacation during QuadA. I was really impressed with how long the fires remained lit in the drinks. Unfortunately their spring seasonal menu was too intriguing and I ordered four, plus the bartenders did shots with me. This did not end well later at the hotel. But at the time it was amazing. They had a drink with a garam masala or something similar that was one of the most interesting tiki drinks I've ever had. I got the little head mug and dropped it at the hotel atrium trying to take a selfie with a waterfall. It now sits in the Enchanted Tibby Room as a reminder of the dangers that these drinks hold. TikiDeathMetal ‚Äì Date: Unknown Interesting take on a tiki bar. The drinks were strong and the decor was enjoyable. The taco truck out front was a nice touch. DeltaTikiphile ‚Äì 13 July 2025 Is Chopper a Tiki Bar??  I'm still not 100% sure, but they have some of the best Tiki drinks I've had anywhere.  Their Mai Tai (always a good starting point) is better than on point.  Their addition of Creole Shrubb in lieu of Curacao really makes it a Mai Tai that tastes like it should - but somehow better.  To top it off, it's served in a robot "rum barrel" that I took home with me to add to my burgeoning collection.  Their "Fountain of Muses" is a cachaca, rum, & sherry concoction served up in a coupe that looks and tastes like Tiki perfection.  I wanted to taste my way through the menu, but I'll have to do that on another visit.  It's a great pseudo-tiki bar, filled with the best Tiki drinks - but the "escapism" escaped when the robots came in.  Chopper gets bonus points for actually serving drinks in branded mugs and glassware - a feat that fewer Tiki bars are attempting these days - and Chopper prints it right on the menu: "these glasses/mugs are for sale, but if you steal them we will charge your card $100 ea."  Good for them. Chopper is a GREAT bar, and is probably a great Tiki bar, but my gatekeeping instincts cringe at the liberties they have taken.  It is said that the lighting makes it better at night.  I'd like to see that for myself, as we were there during the day.  They have huge garage doors (that they open during fair weather) that flood daylight into the space during the day.  This is another cringe point for the Delta Tikiphile. Anyway, don't let my lukewarm review keep you away.  Their cocktails rival the best I've had at Smuggler's Cove, Secret Island, and 4 Kahunas, but I just wish they'd sprinkle in a little more escapism into their robot mix. DRock ‚Äì Date: Unknown Awesome Mai tai. Mexican food was served from food  truck outside. Different robot tiki atmosphere.
